summary: The Securing America's Ports of Entry Act of 2025 aims to enhance security at U.S. ports of entry. It mandates the hiring of 1,000 new Customs and Border Protection officers annually, along with support staff, while considering workload staffing models. The bill requires reports on infrastructure improvements to combat drug trafficking, temporary duty assignments, and U.S. Customs and Border Protection agreements. It also mandates an annual report on staffing and updates to previous reports related to resource optimization.
